website_summaries.verdict: This sturdy knife comes in two sizes and is built to withstand whatever dirty job you can throw at it.
pros: Stainless-steel blade with ergonomic, easy-grip handle
Plastic sheath covers the blade when not in use
cons: The sheath is flimsy and prone to breaking, so you may want to replace it with a better one

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp and easy to maintain!
customer_reviews.text: I recently got into fishing and needed to find a good fillet knife. I've been a big/longterm fan of Morakniv knives so I decided to purchase this fillet knife. I went on a fishing trip recently and this knife did everything I was looking for it to do. It comes super sharp and ready to fillet any fish. Compared to other Morakniv knives, this was a bit more pricey, but as a brand-loyal shopper, it was more than justified to purchase this fillet knife. I will provide updates as I continue to use this knife, but so far, so good. Morakniv is definitely the budget/high enough quality knife for me.
customer_reviews.author: Mr.Y

customer_reviews.title: Reasonably sharp out of the box and good handling for daily kitchen duties
customer_reviews.text: My mother suffers from arthritis in her hands/fingers and she is an avid collector of cheap, crappy kitchen knives, esp. the kind with slim hard-plastic handles, aka the worst kind for someone with arthritis. This was my attempt at an intervention, a solid all-purpose knife with a comfortable, thicker, slightly rubbery handle. She seems to really like it! She said it's very sharp and good for daily slicing and dicing of veggies, fruit, herbs and also raw meat. Not that she's thrown away any of her prized crappy knives...
customer_reviews.author: Andrea

customer_reviews.title: Good knife, crap sheath
customer_reviews.text: Came sharp and ready to go. Have other Mora knives so seems to be a good buy. However, sheath is a crap design that I can already see breaking soon and there is virtually no other options online. Just loading it into my backpack the little slits were wanting to get stuck on things and idk how much i trust the durability long term. 4 star knife and great bang for your buck but I see myself custom ordering a new way to store it which is going to cost more than the knife!
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: its a joy. Razor-sharp out of the box
customer_reviews.text: This knife changed my life. Before, filleting fish was a chore. Now, its a joy. Razor-sharp out of the box, this knife has just the right amount of flex and cuts through fish skin like it's not even there. I've gotten tons of great fillets from this knife; I really feel like I'm getting every last bit of meat off the fish and thus paying my due respect to nature's harvest. Will be buying more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: md2bee

customer_reviews.title: The knife is great and really sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Ordered another so called brand DPNAO, which was supposed to be made in Germany according to asked question, but it was made in China. Still wanted to give it a chance, but it was sooo dull that it rendered itself useless. So I ordered Morakniv Fishing Comfort Fillet Knife with Sandvik Stainless Steel Blade. The difference between the real Swedish steel and so called steel fillet knife made in China was immediately visible. This is a really sharp fillet knife made in Sweden with Swedish steel. Works like a charm. Will update about durability, but as of now fantastic. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: R

customer_reviews.title: Super sharp and flexible
customer_reviews.text: Used this on a trip to boundary waters. While we did not catch a lot on this trip I was able to use it on a few others. It is very sharp and flexible enough to skin the fillets. I like the holder versatility but I did have trouble putting it back in due to a lack of a guide. Most attempts to put back into the belt holder required two hands. I have had some better knives for this but never better than this for this price. Great product and I will buy it again if lost.
customer_reviews.author: Dan DurigTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Best fillet knife period
customer_reviews.text: Holds an excellent edge, havent even resharpened just stropped and its still razor sharp, 12c27 is good steel unlike the mystery stainless steel most knives are marketed with, good medium taper and corrosion resistance, comfortable and afordable, not to mention the lifetime warranty, good range of ability can process smaller fish but also handle some bigger stuff like mahi and kinfish. Morakniv's value is excellent
customer_reviews.author: Cristian Flores

customer_reviews.title: Definately worth it
customer_reviews.text: This is the first knife I have ever owned that I did not need to sharpen right out of the box. Blade stiffness is slightly flexy. The length is perfect for freshwater fish. The grip is nicely shaped and gripy. I like the "don't lose me" yellow color. The sheath is simple and cleanable, which is a huge plus. The angle of the tip makes sliding it along the spine really easy. It has two different belt clips but I don't use them. Over it is a great knife and my fishing buddies are jealous, which is all you really need in life.
customer_reviews.author: John

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for the purpose, ergonomics, blade geometry, edge, practicality.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent fillet knife. Perfect ergonomics and blade geometry. Comes sufficiently sharp. After almost two years of use I resharpened it at 17.5 degrees. Took me 15 min and the edge is perfect. The skeleton holster is very practical to quickly holster it and quickly rinse it holstered (important if you are on a boat) . All in all is seems perfect for the purpose .
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: it's pretty impresive. I've cleaned countless catfish and bluegill with ...
customer_reviews.text: For a 20 dollar knife, it's pretty impresive. I've cleaned countless catfish and bluegill with it and it still holds a good edge. I will buy this product again when I wear this one out' however many years it may take!
customer_reviews.author: Jchap

customer_reviews.title: Razor sharp and durable
customer_reviews.text: My last fillet knife was a cheap $5 knife, but you get what you pay for and the heat treatment wasn't any good. It would go dull after cleaning about 30 fish. This knife keeps an edge much better and has just the right amount of flexibility for my taste. The sheath is surprisingly well made and convenient to use. The knife is secure and protected, and will not come out unless you firmly pull it by the handle.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: No sheath included
customer_reviews.text: The knife arrived quickly but had no sheath. It says in the product description and on the package that it has a sheath, has a space in the packaging for a sheath, but no sheath was included. How is that not noticed before its shipped?? Its a clear package which clearly has no sheath. The knife was just bare bladed. Returning item for a refund. I'll buy a different brand.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Hanson

customer_reviews.title: I like this knife quite a bit more than my dexter-russels
customer_reviews.text: I like this knife quite a bit more than my dexter-russels. It's very sharp out of the box, and I like the mirror finish on the sides of the blade when I am skinning filets. It also cleans up a little easier than a normal finish too. I wish I could get one about an inch longer because I have encountered a few filets wide enough that I needed to skin in two passes. Not a huge deal but a little more work.
customer_reviews.author: B and B

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and tough blade.
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, very sharp out of the box but needs to be resharpened after about 6 fish. Not as flexible as I'd like, when you press down to cut along the backbone sometimes it cuts through it near the tail while more flexible ones are easier to work down the backbone. Keep it coated in food safe oil, it will rust. Handle is comfortable and clips into the sheath easily. Sheath is tough and rotates to accommodate sitting down and the like.
customer_reviews.author: Gavin

customer_reviews.title: Best filet knife
customer_reviews.text: Ive always used rapala filet knives because its what everyone used. After getting these i cant say enough about how much better they are. I cleaned the weekend catch of 30 saltwater fish easier and cleaner than ever. It also handled cat and stripper like no other. The blade didnt show a bit of dulling and after a quick strop you would know it was ever used.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: the best fillet knife I've ever used
customer_reviews.text: This is by far, the best fillet knife I've ever used. The Morakniv is razor-sharp coming out of the package. It keeps this edge even after cleaning 25 bluegills from the frozen lakes in Michigan. A great fillet knife with a great price.
customer_reviews.author: Heidema

customer_reviews.title: You will be happy you bought this knife and as with any Morakniv, the value cannot be beat...
customer_reviews.text: I love Moraknivs, so when I saw they made a fillet knife, it was a no-brainer. This is now a permanent fixture in my tackle box. The sheath is crazy looking and I was wary, but it works great and keeps the knife dry so it's not rusty next time you use it like I have experienced with a number of other knives. It very sharp with the factory edge and held an edge longer than most other knives I've used. It made quick work of a number of trout. You will be happy you bought this knife and as with any Morakniv, the value is not found anywhere else.
customer_reviews.author: B-BearTop Contributor: Camping

customer_reviews.title: Works like a laser
customer_reviews.text: We got this to filet fish and like all Morakniv knives, it does the job! The knife is lightweight, sharp, and has an ergonomically shaped handle. Despite the difference in hand size, both my wife and I can use it with good results on fish like branzino and red snapper.
customer_reviews.author: orion1113

customer_reviews.title: The steel is top knotch for this price range which translates into less corrosion and a fantastic edge that is both sharp and du
customer_reviews.text: You will probably not find a knife this cheap that is as well constructed. If they made an 8" I would be ecstatic. The steel is top knotch for this price range which translates into less corrosion and a fantastic edge that is both sharp and durable. Unless you plan to move into the near $100 territory, you won't find a better knife IMO.
customer_reviews.author: CameronC

customer_reviews.title: Inexpensive but extremely high quality!
customer_reviews.text: What can I say that hasn't been already said about Mora products!? This is a no frills but extremely great filet knife! The handle is the classic comfortable Mora shape with tons of grip! As a professional sharpener I appreciate how quickly you can get this Swedish stainless to be hair shaving sharp with so little effort. This blade has the right amount of flex and always returns to zero. I will be buying more of these as gifts for all the fishermen in my family. When it comes to cost and quality I don't think Mora can be beat!
customer_reviews.author: T

customer_reviews.title: These knives should cost more
customer_reviews.text: Don't let the price fool you! These are amazing knives! I own several Morakniv knives and they are all crazy sharp and well built. The fillet knife has lasted longer than my old favorite Rapala fillet knives. The Rapala knife handles always come loose. The Morakniv holds an edge longer too.
customer_reviews.author: Aaron K. Garrett

customer_reviews.title: My new favorite knife
customer_reviews.text: I've never owned a quality fillet knife, I've always had some rusty hand-me-down that made cleaning fish the most unpleasant part of the fishing experience. I decided life was too short; humans everywhere are able to clean fish without mangling the fillets, so why not me? I sprung for this 6 inch blade and immediately took it with me to the gulf coast. I used this knife on flounder, snapper, and Spanish mackerel and it worked beautifully. Give it a shot, life is better.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Glaze

customer_reviews.title: Love Morakniv!
customer_reviews.text: We swear by Morakniv! Swedish made and you canoot beat the price. My husband using this one for filleting fish and he uses other for field dressing deer, etc. The overall quality is outstanding and the handle is also comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: ALB

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: It's a Mora, it's tuff, durable, and light weight. I bought this on a Whim. And I can tell you I'm glad I did. Stayed sharp for along time. Gutted a lot of fish and fileted a few bass. Absolutely no regrets. The handle stayed grippy even when wet, and the sheath is awesome looking and kept the knife secured at all times
customer_reviews.author: Corey Millard

customer_reviews.title: Great knife, with the sheath was better
customer_reviews.text: Great knife, razor sharp. I just wish it came with a better sheath. I keep this knife in my spear fishing gear bag, and I’m always worried that it will get bent, or come out of the sheath in the bag, and I’ll cut my hand on it when I reach in.
customer_reviews.author: T. Fleming

customer_reviews.title: My last medium sized filet knife
customer_reviews.text: Sweede made flexible filter knife. I'm a bit of a knife geek and believe that every knife you own should preform it propose. As a medium filet knife it does just that. It arrives sharp enough to do its job but I never buy a knife with out sharpening better before use. No knife will just stay sharp and you will have to hone and sharpen Before it gets dull. That is life. This knife holds its edge as to be expected from any filet knife. Buy it if you want a medium grade well designed medium sized fillet knife.
customer_reviews.author: Edward Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Looks good, but dull
customer_reviews.text: Looks good, but performs poorly. Came farilry dull and didnt make it though two rainbow trout. From the beginning, it was a struggle to cut through the fish. Not happy at all, I just wish I was still in my warranty period.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: I bought a terrible fillet knife for significantly more money. This one is perfect. Morakaniv really makes the best knives. I just wished they made a longer one because I fillet large catfish that are more than six inches wide.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: What's not to love. Its a Mora so it came insanely sharp ...
customer_reviews.text: What's not to love. Its a Mora so it came insanely sharp out of the package. Its extremely comfortable even after several hours of use. I prefer this knife over my Cutco fisherman solution fillet knife. Please don't tell my mother in law as she bought the f.s. fillet knife for me and paid 4 times as much as my Mora. You can never go wrong buying a Morakniv as they are all worth much more then the asking price.
customer_reviews.author: Crabtree Fleck

customer_reviews.title: Clean one, sharpen, repeat
customer_reviews.text: Worked fine for my first Crappie, then butchered the rest. Never seen a knife lose it's edge that fast! Got my old (lost then found) Rapala out and was back in business. It's getting two stars because the handle is comfortable, otherwise just a one or zero.
customer_reviews.author: hobbymaster

customer_reviews.title: Not disappointed!
customer_reviews.text: Product sharp straight out of the package. This is my second morakniv knife and I am not disappointed. I appreciate that the packaging is minimalistic. I deponed 3 pork shoulders and it was still ridiculously sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Daniel

customer_reviews.title: Arrived Sharp
customer_reviews.text: Shaved the hair on my arm right out the box! The only thing I didn’t like was the cheap sheath in comparison with my other two Morakniv’s. But, it not worth docking a star! Made in Sweden on the blade.
customer_reviews.author: Mikel John

customer_reviews.title: Nice knife
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife that Is very sharp. Blade is thin but firm so I like that. Snaps into shear so no falling out and pants clip lets u carry its without a belt, also really like that. For me I use with larger filet knife and use this for trimming and some tougher areas area bones. I don't think it is a full tang blade, but very well made and solid light weight knife. Happy with knife.
customer_reviews.author: Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great knife 👍
customer_reviews.text: Quality and lightweight. I use this knife on every fishing trip. Hasn't lost it's edge yet and have been using pretty heavily. Would recommend to anyone needing a good knife out in the field.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: love it!
customer_reviews.text: I do a lot of fish processing and meat cutting. This is by far the sharpest NEW knife I have ever recieved. I just ordered another for a fishing friend of mine. Great knife for the price. Comes with a plastic sheath and belt attachment.
customer_reviews.author: Allisa

customer_reviews.title: Not sharp, promptly returned
customer_reviews.text: A filet knife should be sharp enough to shave with out of the box. This wasn't. I put it back in the package and sent it back. The sharpness would have been acceptable for a $6 knife, not for $25. I didn't get a chance to review anything else.
customer_reviews.author: bunshi

customer_reviews.title: Should be rated as #1
customer_reviews.text: The reviews are on the money. Lost my best fillet knife the other day. I was going to bite the bullet and spend over $100 on a top 3 knifes. So glad I didn't. Never though any knife could be as good as my old friend. I was wrong. Don't hesitate on buying this one. You will not be disappointed.
customer_reviews.author: C. maynard

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding at this price point
customer_reviews.text: I have a five gallon pail with a tackle apron and I keep this attached to the pail and it is in my SUV all spring/summer/fall. Just the thing for panfish and trout.
customer_reviews.author: Stumpkiller

customer_reviews.title: I have been looking for a good fillet knife and tried a bunch of different brands
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a good fillet knife and tried a bunch of different brands. This is very sharp and holds up well. If I could change 1 thing about it, I would make it slightly more flexible. It's a bit stiff for my taste when filleting small panfish.
customer_reviews.author: Rob D.

customer_reviews.title: As usual, Morakniv is the best!
customer_reviews.text: As usual, Morakniv is the best. A knife that holds an edge makes jobs like cleaning fish a lot easier and quicker. When I'm done, I just run the blade across a steel a few times and it's ready for the next time. I didn't think I'd like the plastic sheath but it totally makes sense. It dosen't trap water in it causing problems. It lets water drain out while protecting the blade when I pack it in my backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Alley cat

customer_reviews.title: Filet time
customer_reviews.text: Super Sharp, thin flexible blade lightweight, the sheath leaves a little to be desired but you can see through it and a wet blade will dry easier with this sheath. It's great for small to medium-sized fish and very easy to reach sharpen
customer_reviews.author: goose

customer_reviews.title: easy to grip
customer_reviews.text: The knife is everything I'd expect. Flexible, wicked sharp, easy to grip, etc. The plastic scabbard is fairly cheap, and probably won't hold up for long. That's actually a big deal if you're going to carry this knife around.
customer_reviews.author: steve

customer_reviews.title: Mora knives rock
customer_reviews.text: I’m a fan of Swedish steel in general and Mora Knives in particular, I have a few. Well crafted and sharp even as it arrived.
customer_reviews.author: Bryan M. Whitehead

customer_reviews.title: Mora!
customer_reviews.text: It's a freaking Morakniv. They are a good brand. I like the filet knife. I use it for deer and fish. It cuts well. There is a good holder and belt clip with a retention system so it doesn't just fall out of its scabbard.
customer_reviews.author: Gary W. Barker Jr.

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: GREAT BUT SHARP
customer_reviews.text: SHARP!!!! My husband loves this knife, but buyer beware SUPER SHARP!!! Can cut through packaging as you open it.
customer_reviews.author: Darkstar

customer_reviews.title: sharp sharp sharp
customer_reviews.text: great super sharp knife, have one of their utility knives & it is also very very sharp. hi grade stainless keep them on boat- saltwater use so far no rust showing.
customer_reviews.author: dm

customer_reviews.title: Morafantastic
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the fishing. Best feeling handle of any fishing knife i have ever purchased.
customer_reviews.author: shameous o'shantie

customer_reviews.title: Sharp, balanced and lightweight
customer_reviews.text: Amazing Moro knofe, I've had two of these, razor sharp, and I sharpened a bit more for camping and fillet. Fish don't stand a chance. I also use it to trim roast, chicken and all kinds of meats at home.
customer_reviews.author: Pamela R

customer_reviews.title: I Like the open vented sheath which prevents moisture buildup
customer_reviews.text: Item arrived ahead of schedule. Knife was razor sharp. I Like the open vented sheath which prevents moisture buildup. Came with 2 belt clips, one open, one closed. This is a high quality, Swedish made knife at a very reasonable price. Very pleased with purchase. Will be making future purchases with seller.
customer_reviews.author: cjb63

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommended
customer_reviews.text: I originally bought this knife as a fillet knife. After I purchases it I ended up buying a leech lake fillet knife, needless to say I never actually used it to fillet fish. My wife confiscated it and started using it as a general kitchen knife and it is by far her favorite. She now wants me to purchase another one so she has two. Great product, great knife I highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jason B

customer_reviews.title: Very nice Knife. Holds an edge well
customer_reviews.text: Very nice Knife. Holds an edge well, and is shaped perfectly for everything from filleting and boning, to thin slicing tomatoes. I'll probably order another one, just to have an extra one on hand. It's destined to be one of my favorite kitchen knives.
customer_reviews.author: Stephen A. Trulove

customer_reviews.title: Good value
customer_reviews.text: Great knife for the price. I have cleaned around 75 panfish and haven’t needed to sharpen it yet.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Disappointed
customer_reviews.text: The knife claims to be stainless. After one use out saltwater fishing, spots started to rust and was impossible to clean off. Knife dulled after 3 days of fileting fish. The sheath is terrible. Won't stay together. If you move quickly to a pole while fish is on, knife falls out or the sheath falls apart from belt loop. Design a better sheath. Maybe a simple nylon sheath rather than plastic with terrible connection components.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: Highly satisfied
customer_reviews.text: Its a Mora, nothing else really needs to be said. Came sharp, nice grip, adequate flexibility. Perfect in the field or at home. Has option for two different styles to clip on belt or gear. I'll never need to buy another fillet knife after this.
customer_reviews.author: jeremyva

customer_reviews.title: RUST RUST in a week
customer_reviews.text: Bought one several months ago was fine, then ordered these two and they rust bad,
customer_reviews.author: steve  benifiel

customer_reviews.title: ... owned many Moraknic companions and this one does a great job at filleting most of my fish except for ...
customer_reviews.text: Have owned many Mora companions and this one does a great job at filleting most of my fish except for large salmon it is not quite long enough..like the sheath and the loop options and does a great job. well made knife!
customer_reviews.author: Unreel77

customer_reviews.title: Great
customer_reviews.text: I love these knives. They come highly recommended from one of my favorite youtubers! @freerangesailing
customer_reviews.author: RJ

customer_reviews.title: Works better as a paring knife than a filet knife
customer_reviews.text: Not a great filleting knife as the short blade is not flexible like I thought it would be. Very sharp blade and comfortable handle. This is my new paring knife. Canned a lot of tomatoes this month and this has been my go-to knife. Used as a filet knife... not so great; used as a pairing knife... love it!
customer_reviews.author: Raymond Miller

customer_reviews.title: Good lord this knife is sharp.
customer_reviews.text: Purchased this filet knife on Amazon in 2015. Blade arrived very sharp. I maintain the blade with a leather strop... Now it's stupid sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin

customer_reviews.title: Fillet Knife is awesome
customer_reviews.text: Title says it all. This helped us cut up 2 large tuna we caught. I'd get another. The sheath really does help it dry quickly after use, clean up and then storage.
customer_reviews.author: Dan

customer_reviews.title: Great tool!!
customer_reviews.text: A little too short and thick bladed to be a fillet knife for most uses, but makes a great tool for cutting bait. The quality is great and the blade comes super sharp and holds its edge. Haven't had to re-sharpen it yet, but expect good results. Morakniv makes excellent knives for a guy who wants the best at a price most can afford.
customer_reviews.author: husker415

customer_reviews.title: Fits well in my hand & it is easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Sharp right out of the box. Fits well in my hand & it is easy to use. Very please with this item. It is the third knife I have purchased now from Morakniv. I am sure there will be more in the future.
customer_reviews.author: Tom

customer_reviews.title: Worth the cash
customer_reviews.text: Like all the Morakniv knives I've purchased, this one was cheap in price, sharp out of the box,and high on value. Great knife to use in the kitchen cutting meat and fish
customer_reviews.author: CZ

customer_reviews.title: Good sharp nice for fishing
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my husband for Christmas. He says it works well. It cut very nice and is a must have for fishing.
customer_reviews.author: goht

customer_reviews.title: My Mom’s favorite
customer_reviews.text: Bought it as a gift for my mom she loves it
customer_reviews.author: Nick

customer_reviews.title: Sharpest fillet knife ever
customer_reviews.text: My friend said it's the sharpest fillet knife he has ever used, and he has been a professional fisherman for decades, cutting up tuna, mahimahi, marlin and other Pacific ocean fish. I hope it stays sharp or is able to be sharpened to this point of sharpness.
customer_reviews.author: EzereBartonne

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic knife
customer_reviews.text: Used this on my first catch of the season and it was one of the easiest fillets I've ever cut. Comes sharp and ready to go. Love the two attachments for the sheath. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: Erik

customer_reviews.title: Sharp!
customer_reviews.text: Filleted some catfish with this knife and it worked great!
customer_reviews.author: Scott Bunn

customer_reviews.title: Not so sharp
customer_reviews.text: I own several Morakniv and love them all. This knife is the exact shape and size that I wanted to process deer. My problem is that it doesn't hold an edge as well my others. Not sure what the difference is.
customer_reviews.author: Nakz96744

customer_reviews.title: Incredibly sharp knife, I think I own at least ...
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly sharp knife, I think I own at least one different type of Mora knives that are made and still buying more. I also own expensive knives but nothing beats the quality and price of Mora.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Sheno

customer_reviews.title: and is the perfect length for filleting
customer_reviews.text: My husband loves it. Says it holds an edge really well for a cheaper knife, and is the perfect length for filleting.
customer_reviews.author: Emily

customer_reviews.title: Moras are great values, and this is no exception
customer_reviews.text: Moras are great values, and this is no exception. Really nice, even grind and the sheath is a nice touch. Flex in the blade is similar to the Victorinox boning knife.
customer_reviews.author: Tyler

customer_reviews.title: Great knife for the price!
customer_reviews.text: Watch your fingers when you get this knife. It is VERY sharp and filets fish with ease. I keep this knife with me on my fishing kayak for catch and cook, or preparing cut bait.
customer_reviews.author: Greg B.

customer_reviews.title: I love Morakiv
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for my tackle box. The sheath is a little cheap, but it allows the blade to breath.
customer_reviews.author: T. Donovan

customer_reviews.title: great knife
customer_reviews.text: This thing has changed the way I behave in the kitchen. Meat tissue doesn't stand a chance
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: NEVER met a Mora I didn't like!!
customer_reviews.text: Comfy grip, razor sharp out of the box. Isn't my choice to fillet but on a trout.....ya buddy! Biggest problem with a Mora, including this one, is keeping it out of your "buddies" tackle boxes!!
customer_reviews.author: Steve 55

customer_reviews.title: Great knife! I take this knife fishing everytime
customer_reviews.text: Great knife! I take this knife fishing everytime. Very light weight and compact. The plastic sheath locking feature is great and doesnt slip off.
customer_reviews.author: Weezy

customer_reviews.title: Perfect fillet knife for the Prized catch
customer_reviews.text: Nice flexible knife, I used the Amazon reviews to make this purchase for my hubby & he likes this better than his expensive Gerber knife that cost more than 2 x's the amount of this knife on Amazon. It has nice flexibility & is very sharp, perfect for filleting that prized catch
customer_reviews.author: DebbieJo

customer_reviews.title: Great knife!
customer_reviews.text: Very sharp and holds an edge well. Love my Mora knives!
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: knife good
customer_reviews.text: Good steel. simple design. It's a bit short, so if you fillet anything bigger than a largemouth bass, you're gonna want a bigger knife.
customer_reviews.author: Ninja Turkey

customer_reviews.title: Great Fillet Knife
customer_reviews.text: Amazing fillet knife. My husband loves the control & good grip you get when filleting fish. He does a lot of bluegill fishing & this knife is great for filleting them
customer_reviews.author: Mandisa  Eure

customer_reviews.title: Perfect gifts for the anglers in the family
customer_reviews.text: Bought two as Christmas gifts for my son and father-in-law. Perfect gifts for the anglers in the family.
customer_reviews.author: S. Jones

customer_reviews.title: Very sharp and nice quality
customer_reviews.text: This is a very nice quality knife and super sharp. Hope I don't cut myself. Hopefully it holds up to saltwater fishing and does not rust like some cheaper knives. time will tell.
customer_reviews.author: Cam Neil

customer_reviews.title: Excellent fishing knife
customer_reviews.text: Excellent knife for cleaning fish. Scabard is a good design for safety and allowing knife to fully dry after washing.
customer_reviews.author: Mrs.Robbins

customer_reviews.title: Best deboning and carving knife.
customer_reviews.text: This 3 1/2 inches knife is the best deboning and carving knife I ever used. The curved tip makes carving big fish easy. It has adequate stiffness and strength to cut through small bones. With this knife, I don’t leave much meat on the bones. Very sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Ivan

customer_reviews.title: Always go with Mora.
customer_reviews.text: Mora... need I say more!? I love their stuff - great quality at a low price. This knife is no exception.
customer_reviews.author: Paul

customer_reviews.title: Great knife
customer_reviews.text: Arrives dull but once sharpened.. WOW!! Works great. Fileting sheepshead like butter (they are tough skinned)
customer_reviews.author: Kenneth L Asche

customer_reviews.title: MUCH better than the cheap filet knives I've used in the ...
customer_reviews.text: Processed 2 deer with it in one sitting, and it was still sharp at he end! MUCH better than the cheap filet knives I've used in the past, that I'd have to sharpen 3-4x per deer!
customer_reviews.author: MikeB

customer_reviews.title: Great Fillet Knife
customer_reviews.text: Great fillet knife. Well balanced, extremely sharp and makes filleting easy! The belt clip that comes with it is still in my knife drawer, didn't need. Cover is handy and provides protection when not in use. Would recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Buy, Sharp Edge, Flexible Blade, Secure Grip, Adequate Sheath = 5/5
customer_reviews.text: Awesome blade for filleting those feesh. Salt water not a problem yet. Not a huge fan of the sheath, but it makes sense to allow moisture to escape. Sharp edge, easy to touch up. Knife handle is secure when wet and slimy, and a nice size for my medium to large hands.
customer_reviews.author: John Castillo

customer_reviews.title: Perfect trout knife
customer_reviews.text: Great fillet knife for small to to medium sized fish
customer_reviews.author: Henry Fabela

customer_reviews.title: No flex
customer_reviews.text: Very rigid with no flex. It’s like using a butcher knife to skin a fish!
customer_reviews.author: jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Cut above!
customer_reviews.text: Great little filet knife. Feels good in the hand and works very well. Easy to keep sharp.
customer_reviews.author: Andrew R. Lawler

customer_reviews.title: Garbage blade
customer_reviews.text: What a piece of junk. Lost it's edge on the first fish. Couldn't make one good cut. It's about equal to a 4 dollar Walmart knife
customer_reviews.author: john brandenstein

customer_reviews.title: Perfect knife to keep on the boat
customer_reviews.text: Great knife cuts really well stay sharp and seems to hold up. I would definitely buy this again.
customer_reviews.author: Jonathan Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: Nice knife, very sharp should be great for Kokanee just as I hoped.
customer_reviews.author: Keith

customer_reviews.title: Four Stars
customer_reviews.text: Not a bad little fillet knife. Does a good job on crappie and panfish.
customer_reviews.author: VN Ranger

customer_reviews.title: Very good handle. Belt loop does not have to be ...
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely incredible for the price. Very hard well-tempered steel, so it will not need constant sharpening. Very good handle. Belt loop does not have to be attached, so if you plan to keep it in the toolbox​ - it will save a lot of space. No regrets whatsoever.
customer_reviews.author: L. Epstein

customer_reviews.title: Five Stars
customer_reviews.text: This has become my go to knife for everything in the kitchen,very sharp
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Very nice fillet knife
customer_reviews.text: I have been looking for a great fillet knife for a very long time. The 1 I've been using is almost 20 years old and really needed to be replaced. I've bought 3 since my original very nice fillet knife and they all were junk. This thing exceeds expectations.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas

product_meta.title: Morakniv Fishing Comfort Fillet Knife with Sandvik Stainless Steel Blade
product_meta.description: Morakniv Fishing Comfort Fillet knives are available in either a versatile 6.1-inch length for cleaning and filleting most sizes of fish or in a 3.5-inch length for removing bones and for smaller pan fish. Both Morakniv Fishing Comfort Fillet knife options come with patterned, high-friction grip handles that allow users to maintain a steady grip even when slimy from cleaning fish. The plastic sheath is simple, rugged, cleans easily, and it does not absorb odors. The 6.1-inch knife comes with two interchangeable belt clips so that users can either clip to or loop it through a belt. The sheath on the 3.5-inch knife includes a single belt clip. The Sandvik 12C27 stainless steel used for Morakniv fillet knives is known for its razor sharpness, high hardness, exceptional toughness, and excellent corrosion resistance. Morakniv has been manufacturing the highest-quality knives in Mora, Sweden since 1891. Professionals worldwide trust the quality materials and fine craftsmanship of Morakniv knives. Morakniv Fishing Comfort Fillet knives are made in Sweden and include a limited lifetime manufacturer's warranty.
feature_bullets: Stainless steel fillet knife with patterned, high-friction handle; available in 3.5-inch or 6.1-inch blade lengths
6.1-inch blade is versatile enough for most sizes of fish; slotted plastic sheath is easy to clean and includes two belt clips: belt-loop or clip-on
Sandvik 12C27 stainless steel is known for its razor sharpness, high hardness, exceptional toughness, and excellent corrosion resistance
High-friction handle allows users to maintain grip when cleaning fish; does not absorb odors
Blade thickness: 0.07 inches (1.9 mm); blade length: 6.1 inches (155 mm), total length: 10.6 inches (270 mm), net weight: 3.5 oz. (99g)
